name: diesel, burned in agricultural machinery | diesel, burned in agricultural machinery | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15822/documentation

This dataset represents an example of 1 MJ (0.0222 kg) diesel burned for running a tractor with a trailer. The inventory represents heavy road transport with tractor and 2 tyre-trailers of max. 8 t loading capacity each. Mean velocity when loaded = 15 km/h. Mean velocity when empty = 25 km/h. Empty return over the same distance included. Transported goods not included. 1 kg Diesel burned (corresponds to 45 MJ diesel) which equates to 1 t of good transported for 1 km. The operation time is 0.0071 h/kg diesel.

From the load of material to be transported.

The activity ends with the transportation of tractor and trailer when 1 MJ (0.0222 kg) of diesel is burned. The dataset includes the diesel fuel consumption and the amount of agricultural machinery and of the shed, which has to be attributed to the road transport of goods, with a tractor and two tyre trailers, (goods were not considered). Also taken into consideration is the amount of emissions to the air from combustion and the emission to the soil from tyre abrasion during the transport. The following activities where considered part of the work process: preliminary work at the plant, like attaching the trailer to the tractor; road transport for 0.0222 km and concluding work, like uncoupling the machine. The dataset doesn't include the dust other than from combustion and noise.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Fuels; Agriculture & Animal Husbandry

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period referring to the data source: 1999-2001. Based on expert opinion data is considered to be valid at least up to 2012.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Values given in the reference are representative for the chosen work processes. Processes are typical procedures for Switzerland around the year 2000, they are not statistical average processes.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The inventory is based on the ecoinvent activity 'transport, tractor and trailer, agricultural, CH'. Adaptation: The function unit is replaced from 1 tkm to 1 MJ (i.e.0.0222 kg) diesel. 
The inventoried HC, NOx, CO and fuel consumption values are measurements made following two test cycles (ISO 8178 C1 test and a specific 6-level-test created by Agroscope) and on measurements made during the field work. The other emissions were calculated basing on literature data and the measured fuel consumption.
The inventories are based on measurements made by the Institute for Sustainability Sciences of Agroscope. Fuel consumption and emissions were taken from recent literature of Agroscope, expert's estimations or unpublished data.

exchanges.description: 1.0 MJ (i.e. 0.0222 kg) diesel burned in tractor. Includes diesel production and combustion, tractor manufacturing and road abrasion. 1 kg diesel (45 MJ) corresponds to 1 t of good transported for 1 km. The operation time is 0.0071 h/kg diesel.

exchanges.description: The functional unit is 1kg machinery during its lifetime. Calculations are made with a mean machinery weight of 1000 kg, 1000 hours lifetime and 0.54 repair factor. Representatives of this class of machinery are for example: seeder, hoe or self-loading trailer. The value is calculated by multiplying the weight of the machinery with the operation time (1.63E-01 hours per kg of diesel) and dividing by the lifetime capacity (1000 h) and the calorific value of diesel (45 ML per kg of diesel).

exchanges.description: The functional unit is 1kg machinery during its lifetime. Assumptions: machinery weight of 3000 kg, 7000 hours lifetime and 0.74 repair factor; representativeness of this class of machinery are for example: tractor. The value is calculated by multiplying the weight of the machinery with the operation time (1.63E-01 hours per kg of diesel) and dividing by the lifetime capacity (7000 h) and the calorific value of diesel (45 ML per kg of diesel).
